<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 643, 92]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the stretching of a spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 876, 139]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 1.1. The spring has been set up for you. Do not change its position.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 148, 526, 260]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 457, 625, 490]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 508, 532, 527]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 540, 144, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 540, 180, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 540, 875, 574]]<|/det|>
Measure the vertical distance \(d_0\), in mm, between the bottom of the spring and the surface of the bench.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 586, 875, 606]]<|/det|>
\[d_0 = .................................................... \text{mm}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 617, 181, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 617, 675, 636]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 1.1, mark clearly the distance you have measured.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 648, 180, 667]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 648, 875, 698]]<|/det|>
Hang a 1.0N load on the spring. Record the value of the load \(L\) in Table 1.1. Measure, and record in the table, the distance \(d\) between the bottom of the spring and the surface of the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 710, 180, 728]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 710, 875, 744]]<|/det|>
Calculate the extension \(e\) of the spring using the equation \(e = (d_0 - d)\). Record the value of \(e\) in the table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 757, 180, 775]]<|/det|>
<label>(v)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 756, 875, 790]]<|/det|>
Repeat steps (iii) and (iv) using loads of 2.0N, 3.0N, 4.0N and 5.0N. Record all the readings and results in the table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 656, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 494, 875, 528]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 540, 574, 559]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 571, 875, 604]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 617, 667, 636]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 118, 146, 137]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 636, 806, 656]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 808, 106]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the refraction of light passing through a transparent block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 576, 139]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[203, 144, 792, 714]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 721, 532, 740]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 816, 91]]<|/det|>
Place the transparent block, largest face down, on the ray-trace sheet supplied

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 87, 828, 121]]<|/det|>
block should be approximately in the middle of the paper. Draw the outline of the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 875, 168]]<|/det|>
Remove the block and draw a normal at the centre of side \(\mathbf{AB}\). Label the point \(\mathbf{E}\) where the normal crosses \(\mathbf{AB}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 183, 144, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 181, 875, 215]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(\mathbf{FE}\) to the left of the normal and at an angle of incidence \(i = 30^{\circ}\) to the normal as shown in Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 228, 146, 246]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 227, 875, 262]]<|/det|>
Place two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) on the line \(\mathbf{FE}\), placing one pin close to \(\mathbf{E}\). Mark the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 144, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 273, 875, 352]]<|/det|>
Replace the block and observe the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) through side \(\mathbf{CD}\) of the block, so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) appear one behind the other. Place two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) between your eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\), and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) seen through the block, appear one behind the other. Mark the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\). Remove the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 365, 144, 383]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 875, 400]]<|/det|>
Draw a line joining the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\). Continue the line until it meets \(\mathbf{CD}\) and label this point \(\mathbf{G}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 413, 146, 432]]<|/det|>
<label>(g)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 413, 304, 432]]<|/det|>
Draw the line \(\mathbf{GE}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 444, 146, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>(h)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 444, 828, 463]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the angle of refraction \(r\) between the line \(\mathbf{GE}\) and the normal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 475, 875, 494]]<|/det|>
<form>r = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 504, 141, 523]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 584, 875, 612]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\frac{i}{r} =\) .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 651, 873, 670]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 728, 144, 747]]<|/det|>

<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[789, 900, 876, 917]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 10]
